hero.heading: Your Physiotherapist
paragraphs: Alex is a qualified physiotherapist with experience across the NHS and private settings in the UK and New Zealand. His work spans acute care, rehabilitation and injury recovery.

Alex has a focused interest in rehabilitation â€” specifically around injury recovery, pain management and supporting stroke recovery, Parkinsonâ€™s, mobility issues, and post-hospital rehabilitation. He also helps older adults build confidence and independence.
Alex founded Ask Alex Physiotherapy to deliver expert, personalised care around your life â€” in your home, at a clinic, or online.

seo.blurb: Ask Alex Physiotherapy provides private physiotherapy in London and online with specialist neurological rehabilitation alongside MSK, falls prevention, post-operative recovery and elderly care. Sessions are personalised to your goals using evidence-based practice â€” delivered at home, in-clinic or remotely.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.intro: Quick answers about care at home, in-clinic, and online. If you canâ€™t find your answer, send a message and Alex will help.

items.a: I have an extensive background in rehab for neurological (stroke, Parkinsonâ€™s, MS, traumatic brain injury), respiratory (COPD, IPF, bronchiectasis and others), and general physical impairments. I also treat MSK pain, soft tissue injuries, arthritis, and support post-surgical recovery.
Home visits across North London (e.g., Barnet, Finchley, Enfield, Hampstead and nearby). If youâ€™re unsure if I cover your area, ask and Iâ€™ll confirm.
Yes â€” Iâ€™m HCPC registered (reg number PH134533) and fully insured as a member of the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy.

Tap any â€œBook Nowâ€ button or use the contact form. You'll get a free 10â€“15 minute intro call, then a Stripe payment link to confirm your booking, along with a consent form and appointment details.
Home visits: Initial 60â€“75 mins; follow-ups 45â€“60 mins. In-clinic: Initial 60 mins; follow-ups 45â€“60 mins. Online: 45â€“60 mins via secure video.
Please give 24 hoursâ€™ notice to reschedule or cancel. Charges may apply to late cancellations or missed appointments.

items.q: What should I prepare for a home visit?
items.a: Clear a small safe space, wear comfortable clothing, and have any recent clinic letters or medication lists to hand. I bring essential equipment and follow infection-control standards.
Travel within my normal coverage is included. For addresses further out, Iâ€™ll confirm any small travel supplement in advance.
I organise an accessible treatment room in North London â€” full address and access info are provided when you book. If you prefer not to travel, you can book home or online sessions.

items.q: What do I need for online sessions?
items.a: A device with camera and a stable internet connection. Iâ€™ll send a secure video link. Try to position the camera so I can see you moving clearly.
Secure card payment via Stripe or a bank transfer. Youâ€™ll receive a receipt and invoice automatically.

items.q: Do you accept private medical insurance?
items.a: Iâ€™m a private practice and can provide invoices/receipts for you to claim back if your insurer allows self-pay reimbursement. Please check your policy.
Yes. Records are stored in a GDPR-compliant system (WriteUpp) with appropriate access controls. I only keep information necessary for your care.

sections.heading: Scope of Services
sections.body: Ask Alex Physiotherapy provides physiotherapy services including assessment, treatment, and rehabilitation advice. Services are delivered in person (home visits or clinic) and online. Physiotherapy is not a substitute for medical diagnosis or emergency care.

sections.heading: Booking & Cancellations
list: Appointments may be booked via email, phone, or through our online platform.
Cancellations with less than 24 hoursâ€™ notice may incur a full session fee.
We may reschedule or cancel sessions due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., illness or emergencies).

sections.heading: Payment
sections.body: Payment is due at the time of service or as agreed in advance. Accepted payment methods will be confirmed upon booking.

sections.heading: Online Consultations
sections.body: Online sessions are suitable for assessments, guided rehabilitation, and advice. Clients must ensure a safe environment and disclose relevant health conditions. We are not liable for injuries sustained during unsupervised exercise.

sections.heading: Client Responsibilities
list: Provide accurate health and contact information.
Inform us of changes to your condition or medications.
Follow clinical advice and safety instructions during treatment.

sections.heading: Intellectual Property
sections.body: All website content (text, graphics, logo, media) is the property of Ask Alex Physiotherapy and may not be reproduced without permission.

sections.heading: Website Use
sections.body: You agree not to misuse or interfere with the website, upload malicious code, or infringe upon the rights of others.

sections.heading: Limitation of Liability
sections.body: We take reasonable measures to ensure safe and effective treatment; however, we are not responsible for loss, injury, or damages resulting from misuse of advice or failure to disclose health information.

sections.heading: Governing Law
sections.body: These terms are governed by the laws of England and Wales. Disputes are subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the UK courts.

sections.heading: Contact
sections.body: For questions about these terms, contact Ask Alex Physiotherapy at hello@askalexphysiotherapy.com or +44 7594 909 780.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.summary: How Ask Alex Physiotherapy collects, uses, and safeguards personal data under UK GDPR.

sections.heading: Who We Are
sections.body: Ask Alex Physiotherapy provides specialist neurorehabilitation and general physiotherapy services through home visits, in-clinic sessions, and online consultations. Based in Barnet, London.

sections.heading: What Information We Collect
list: Personal details â€“ name, email, phone, address, emergency contacts.
Medical information â€“ health conditions, medications, symptoms, GP/consultant details.
Technical information â€“ IP address, browser data, and basic analytics via Squarespace.

sections.heading: How We Use Your Information
list: To provide physiotherapy services.
To maintain accurate medical records.
To communicate regarding appointments or services.
To comply with legal and regulatory obligations.

sections.heading: Lawful Basis for Processing
list: Consent
Contractual necessity
Legal obligation (e.g., healthcare law)
Legitimate interests

sections.heading: Data Security & Storage
sections.body: Data is securely stored using encrypted digital systems accessible only by the treating physiotherapist (Alexander Vikentiou). Information is never shared unless required by law or with explicit consent.

sections.heading: Your Rights Under GDPR
list: Access your data.
Request correction or deletion.
Object to or restrict data use.
Complain to the ICO if you believe your data is mishandled.

sections.heading: Cookies & Analytics
sections.body: Cookies and Squarespace analytics help us understand website use. These do not store personal data and can be managed via browser settings.

sections.heading: Third-Party Tools
sections.body: We use trusted third-party tools for video consultations, email, or bookings â€” each compliant with its own data protection policies.

sections.heading: Data Retention
sections.body: Medical records are retained for a minimum of 8 years in line with UK healthcare law. Enquiry data may be held for up to 12 months. Analytics data is anonymised.

sections.heading: Contact
sections.body: For data enquiries, contact Ask Alex Physiotherapy at hello@askalexphysiotherapy.com or +44 7594 909 780.

meta.description: Ask Alex Physiotherapy Privacy Policy â€” explains how personal and medical data are handled in compliance with UK GDPR and healthcare standards.

physiotherapy.title: Private physiotherapy sessions
physiotherapy.subtitle: Home, clinic and online sessions tailored to your goals. Recovery Plans offer the best value for consistent progress.

items.name: Initial appointment
items.description: Full assessment, diagnosis, goal setting and first treatment.

items.name: Follow-up session
items.description: Ongoing treatment sessions to build on your progress.

items.name: Recovery Plan â€“ 4 sessions
items.description: Ideal for short-term rehab or focused pain management.

items.name: Recovery Plan â€“ 6 sessions
items.description: Designed for sustainable progress and measurable outcomes.

classes.title: Community exercise & wellbeing classes
classes.subtitle: Physiotherapist-led group sessions to support mobility, strength and confidence for older adults and those with neurological or mobility limitations.

items.name: Trial class
items.description: Try a physiotherapist-led group exercise session with no obligation.

items.name: Single group class
items.description: One-off physiotherapist-led group session focused on mobility and confidence.

items.name: 4-class block
items.description: Prepaid block designed to encourage consistent participation and measurable improvement.

items.name: Private group class
items.description: Bespoke session for up to 10 residents of similar functional ability, designed in collaboration with care staff.

notes: Travel within Finchley and surrounding areas is included.
Extended travel (>5 miles) may incur a small surcharge.
Block bookings are payable in full before the first session and valid for 3 months.
Cancellations: Minimum 24 hours' notice required to avoid the full session charge.
Payment options: Bank transfer or card payment (details provided on booking).
Invoices and receipts are provided digitally for all services.
